page.title: 12FOOTPATHS IN WITHYHAM/ST.JN.
page.content: The area covers some of the Ashdown {Forest}which has many{footpaths}some of which go through Fivw Acre Wood. This is where A.A.Milne the famous children's{author}set some of the Pooh stories which are world famous. The names Fishers Gate and Friars Gate recall the time when there were gates onto the forest. One of the footpaths runs onto Church Hill, locally known as Black Hill, and continues in a northerly direction to Withyham Church. Fishers Gate includes a fine Manor House, farm land and several cottages all owned by Earl de la Warr, being part of the Buckhurst estate. Cooks Corner has historical connections with smuggling. There is a footpath off the Lye Green road leading to Park Grove Farm and on to Penns-in-the-Rocks.
